message: http://code.google.com/p/js2-mode/ -- I love it.  Dramatically reduces the amount of illegal javascript I wrote due to the almost-compiler syntax highlighter.
hmm. i've been using espresso mode because I like the indenting better.
But I'd love to hear from someone who's thought about this a lot. What do emacs people do with javascript?
Emacs 23.2 adoped espresso-mode as the official GNU js-mode
js2-mode isn't as active and the author (even though I respect Steve Yegge) doesn't really accept patches quickly
also js-mode (ex-espresso-mode) is much faster than js2-mode, which can be really slow on some bigger files
Hm. I'm still sitting on 23.1 and can't say that I like how js-mode works.
i still use js2-mode for everything
i didn't like the indenting until i found that last bit
I use a similar hack to get around js2's somewhat atrocious indentation https://github.com/dz/emacs/blob/master/configs/js.el
The built-in js-mode (formerly espresso-mode) is the way to go for both JavaScript and JSON, I think. Way less fiddly.
Thanks for the js2 hacks guys, finally useable indentation for anonymous functions passed as arguments!
Is anyone working on getting js2-mode and mumamo working nicely together?
